Traditional approaches to modeling semantic similarity compute the semantic distance between definitions within a single ontology .This single ontology is either a domain - independent ontology or the result of the integration of existing ontologies .We present an approach to computing semantic similarity that relaxes the requirement of a single ontology and accounts for differences in the levels of explicitness and formalization of the different ontology specifications .
